pages.text: After obtaining a $(l)Vault Rock$(), it needs to be $(l)infused$() with the correct $(l)items$() in order to create a Vault Crystal.$(br2)This is done in a $(l)Vault Altar$(). These are blocks that are $(l)bound$() to the player.$(br2)It provides Vault Crystals the ability to construct a $(l)gateway$() to the Vault dimension, by placing a $(l)Vault Rock$() on the Vault Altar.

pages.title: Vault Crystal
pages.text: The requested items can be $(l)dropped$() onto the Vault Altar in order to materialize the Vault Crystal, after which it needs to be $(l)activated$() through $(l)Redstone$().$(br2)The number of requested items $(l)scales$() with $(l)Vault Level$().

pages.title: Vault Crystal
pages.text: Every Vault Crystal has an $(l)Objective$(), $(l)Theme$() and $(l)Layout$().$(br2)The Vault Crystal can be $(l:game_mechanics/crystal_modification)$(l)modified$() with the use of resources from $(l)within Vaults$().$(br2)The $(l)level$() of the Vault attached to the Vault Crystal is bound to the $(l)player's Vault Level$() at the moment it was forged.
